neonNitrate

Overview

The neonNitrate package provides an interactive dashboard and tools for exploring nitrate concentration and related water-quality variables in freshwater ecosystems.
It uses open-access data from the National Ecological Observatory Network (NEON), focusing on nitrate dynamics across U.S. monitoring sites.

Developed for ETC5523 â€“ Communicating With Data (Assignment 4) at Monash University.

ğŸ“Š Package Website:

neonNitrate

neonNitrate pkgdown site

  • ğŸ’§ Cleaned NEON nitrate dataset
  • ğŸŒ Interactive Shiny dashboard for visualization

  • ğŸ§® Summary statistics by site and time
  • ğŸ“ Vignettes and documentation using roxygen2

Installation

Install the development version from GitHub:

install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("ETC5523-2025/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-rimaln")

Quick Start 

library(neonNitrate)

View the dataset 

data(nitrate_clean)
head(nitrate_clean)
summary(nitrate_clean$nitrate_mgL)

Launch interactive dashboard 

run_app()

Description

Variable Description Units
datetime Timestamp of measurement ISO 8601
siteID NEON site code â€”
nitrate_mgL Nitrate concentration mg/L
temperature_C Surface water temperature Â°C
turbidity_NTU Turbidity (water clarity) NTU

Interactive Dashboard

Launch the Shiny dashboard to explore the data interactively:

run_app()

The Shiny dashboard includes three key sections: - Overview â€“ Explore nitrate levels by site and year - Time-Series Trends â€“ Visualize seasonal nitrate variation - Variable Correlations â€“ Compare nitrate with turbidity, temperature, and conductivity

Example Analysis 

library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(ggplot2)

# Example dataset
nitrate_clean <- data.frame(
  siteID = rep("BARC", 12),
  datetime = seq(as.Date("2020-01-01"), by = "month", length.out = 12),
  nitrate_mgL = runif(12, 0.5, 3.5)
)

nitrate_clean |>
  mutate(month = format(datetime, "%b")) |>
  group_by(month) |>
  summarise(mean_nitrate = mean(nitrate_mgL, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = month, y = mean_nitrate)) +
  geom_col(fill = "steelblue") +
  labs(
    title = "Average Monthly Nitrate Concentration â€“ BARC Site",
    x = "Month",
    y = "Nitrate (mg/L)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

Available Datasets

  • nitrate_clean â€“ Cleaned NEON nitrate dataset
  • nitrate_summary â€“ Summarized nitrate data by site and month

Functions

  • run_app() - Launch the Shiny dashboard
  • summarize_nitrate() - Compute nitrate statistics by time or site
  • plot_nitrate_trends() - Generate time-series visualizations
